text:
Hi, 
If one looks even more variation in failure and success. Some of that variation
is insignificant, different routes taken to update Win10 Pro 22H2(Cumulative,
SafeOS, WinRE, and Preview)successfully for all Jan 2024 available updates. 
Here's just one example...and its on an older device - my 8 yr old Surface 3
running Win10 Pro 22H2(I was going to replace this Surface but it keeps on
ticking( by todays standards a bit slow with the Atom chip, 128GB eMMC, 128 GB
SDXC, and 4 GB RAM..and still surprised that the battery after 8 yrs still has
76% of its original capacity) 
This device took a different path to update 22H2 Jan 2024 updates from its fully
updated through Dec 2023 condition(19045.3903) 
Installed the Jan 9 2024 KB5034275(.NET Cumulative) and KB 5034122(Cumulative)
updates successfully without issue - 19045.3930 
KB 5034441 (WinRE update which also applies SafeOS Security update KB5034232)
failed 4 times with the 0x80070643 error 
- WinRE partition size was acceptable - 827 MB total, 526 MB used, 301 MB
free(i.e. more than 250 MB) 
Chose not to tamper with the WinRE partition size, taking a different route. 
Disabled System Restore deleting all System Restore points. 
Ran Disk Cleanup in admin mode selecting every removable item including Windows
upgrade items(~3 GB) 
- took about 15 minutes on this device(slower than usual but for this Surface 3
device reasonably normal) 
Turned off – Receive updates from other Microsoft Products(the Surface has
retail Office 2019 H&B 
Installed the Jan 23 KB5034203 Cumulative Preview successfully - 19045.3996
(this build # .3996 shows up later, see below in ‘Results’) 
Restarted, opened Windows Update and did a 'Check for Updates' 
KB 5034441 again available for download/install but without its prior 'Retry'
message 
=
%40DS0PR10MB7341.namprd10.prod.outlook.com

metadata.topic: Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
